import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.3943a01b:
dataList = [
    pd.read_csv("../input/world-happiness/2015.csv").dropna().drop(["Region", "Happiness Rank"], axis=1).groupby("Country").mean(),
    pd.read_csv("../input/world-happiness/2016.csv").dropna().drop(["Region", "Happiness Rank"], axis=1).groupby("Country").mean(),
    pd.read_csv("../input/world-happiness/2017.csv").dropna().drop("Happiness.Rank", axis=1),
    pd.read_csv("../input/world-happiness/2018.csv").dropna().drop("Overall rank", axis=1),
    pd.read_csv("../input/world-happiness/2019.csv").dropna().drop("Overall rank", axis=1)
]
source.9f9dd431: Firstly, we need to process data as we need. Let's do it.
source.2cc08bf4: To see how happiness changed with time let's claster every data package using mark from 0 (lowest) to 4 (highest) to mark happiness on countries for every year.
source.8f6a650c: As we see, most popular marks are 2 (middle heppiness) and 3 (high heppiness). Also we can see, numbers of marks have distribution similar to normal.
